item.title: MIT Museum Inside Out
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
N52
Location Description: 
MIT Museum
Sponsor: 
Museum
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Free admission all day at the MIT Museum, as it turns itself inside out for the Institute's Open House Day (and the first day of the Cambridge Science Festival!). Go behind the scenes of the Museum and explore unique artifacts from MIT's history, as well as innovations in art, science and technology in Cambridge and beyond. The day's programs will feature tours, hands-on activities, and a chance for visitors of all ages to see and chat with the people behind the Museum's MIT 150 exhibition.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Wind Tunnel tour and Demo
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
17
Location Description: 
Building 17, Wright Brothers Wind Tunnel
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
tour
Max Participants: 
20
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Tour MIT’s historic Wright Brothers Wind Tunnel. Opened in 1938, tunnel tests have ranged from WW2 fighters, to the Epcot Center, to AeroAstro’s new super efficient commercial passenger jet.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Display and Flight demo: TALARIS planetary exploration hopper
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 13:00 - 13:30
Location: 
W34
Location Description: 
Building W34, Johnson Athletics Center
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
video
Family Friendly: 
no

TALARIS is an exciting new concept for planetary exploration that, rather than driving about, flies/hops from point to point on the surface. This prototype platform is partially lifted by fans and propelled by compressed gas jets.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Public Display of Terrestrial Artificial Lunar And Reduced gravity Simulator (TALARIS) Hopper
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
W33
Location Description: 
Building W33, Rockwell Cage
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
video
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

The Terrestrial Artificial Lunar And Reduced gravity Simulator (TALARIS) hopping vehicle will be displayed for the public, with video of tests and posters to illustrate the details of this unique vehicle concept and showcase its capabilities.

item.title: Water Bottle Rocket Launch
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
G15
Location Description: 
Briggs Field
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
children's activity
demonstration
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Watch as students launch various rocket designs made from a 2-litre plastic bottle and powered by water and compressed air. Learn why weight, mass, fin design and placement all make a difference in rocket performance.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Celebrating Discovery at MIT: An Undergraduate Research Poster Session
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 14:00 - 16:00
Location: 
W33
Location Description: 
Building W33, Rockwell Cage
Sponsor: 
Undergraduate Advising and Academic Programming
Format: 
poster session
Max Participants: 
100
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Since 1969, the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program, commonly known as “UROP,” has been facilitating research collaborations between faculty and students, across all disciplines. Today, UROP is considered MIT’s “signature” program, and more than 85% of undergraduates participate.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Blimp Race
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 12:00 - 13:30
Location: 
W34
Location Description: 
Building W34, Johnson Athletics Center
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Students from AeroAstro’s Intro to Aerospace Engineering and Design compete with radio-controlled lighter than air vehicles they designed and built, flying them around an oval course in the Johnson ice rink. Commentary throughout by AeroAstro professor and former astronaut Jeff Hoffman.

item.title: Plasma thruster for spacecraft propulsion demo
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 12:30
Location: 
37
Location Description: 
Building 37 - Room 462A, AeroAstro Lab
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
open facility to visitors
tour
Max Participants: 
12
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Witness the firing of a Hall Thruster Ion rocket motor, designed and built at MIT. (Motor is fired in a vacuum chamber. Viewing limited – 12 in lab, 1 at a time observing though chamber port, also viewable on video panel.)
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Space Propulsion Laboratory Poster
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
37
Location Description: 
Building 37 - Room 462A, AeroAstro Lab
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
poster session
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

A poster explaining the research going on at the Space Propulsion Laboratory will be displayed at the entrance of our lab. Images of our thrusters firing and the different experiments currently being performed in our lab will be shown. Our research ranges from different space propulsion techniques (hall thrusters, electro-sprays...) to the use of very long space tethers for elimination of charged particles in space or the use of very rapid discharges to ignite lean fuel-air mixtures.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Aviation and the Environment
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
33
Location Description: 
Building 33 - Room 115
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

See how, over time, aviation has affected our environment and how MIT researchers are developing ways to make aviation greener. Displays of potential alternative fuel sources, aviation history, maps of Boston-area aviation noise impacts, and more.
item.dc:creator: administrator

Sponsor: 
Engineering Systems Division
Format: 
exhibit
video
Family Friendly:

Watch a video about the MIT Engineering Systems Division, talk to students and staff, and take some ESD materials. There also will be videos about and info tables for the Leaders for Global Operations program and the MIT Portugal Program.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Meet Spacesuit-testing robot, land on the moon and more in Man Vehicle Lab Demos
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
37
Location Description: 
Building 37 - Room 146, AeroAstro Lab
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
tour
Max Participants: 
15
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

11 am – 3pm, hourly on the hour: Meet Madame Talltree, the Lab’s spacesuit-testing robot and see our designs for future planetary exploration.
11:15am-3:15pm, hourly on the quarter hour: Moonwalker demo – our special treadmill that simulates walking and running on the moon and Mars.
11:30-3:30, hourly on the half hour: In a weightless environment, astronauts lose bone and muscle mass. See how our short arm centrifuge might spin them back into shape.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 15:00
Location: 
W34

Building W34, Johnson Athletics Center

Format:

demonstration
hands-on activity

We will be producing airplanes of all colors, shapes and sizes! Prizes will be awarded to the models with the longest range. This activity is ideal for elementary school kids, although all ages are welcome!
